item.title: Abandoned vehicles and dumped rubbish, 26th January
item.description:
There have been a couple of abandoned vehicles and a rolled up mattress with rubbish inside here for a couple of months. Due to the works in Nunhead Cemetery there are parking pressures here. Also, cars keep blocking the emergency access, this is particularly bad on Sundays
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linden Grove, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress , tv and general household waste, 26th January
item.description:
Rubbish been dumped here for over 2 months report to Bexley who say not there problem been in touch with mp who states it is there responsibility. The rubbish is blocking garden and garage entrances as well as attracting vermin .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingfisher Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Risk Assessment, 26th January
item.description:
Contrary to your reply, please can you send the councils risk assessment and install policy on the installation of pedestrian guardrails near schools and how this differs from the Department of Transport guard lines.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harlington Road, Greater London

item.title: Two abandoned bikes on cycle stand in front of 470 Kingsland Rd, 26th January
item.description:
These two bikes have been here for months and are in various states of disrepair — missing wheels, rusted chains, etc. Need to be removed ASAP, makes it difficult for the community to lock their bikes safely.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Fallen leaves and other items., 26th January
item.description:
Fallen leaves from autumn various other items on footpath and gully. Haven't even been cleaned , also very slippery under foot. I'm a 73 oap and have nearly slipped on several occasions. Not just my location but nearly every street and pavement in my area. It's an absolute disgrace for it to be left like that.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Linnet Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet
